item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Anarchy in Sudan has spawned the world’s worst famine in 40 years (12 points | discuss)
2. Honey, I shrunk {fmt}: bringing binary size to 14k and ditching the C++ runtime (76 points | 15 comments)
3. C Course Online (26 points | 1 comment)
4. Einstein's Other Theory of Everything (21 points | 1 comment)
5. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (632 points | 61 comments)

7. Playstation 2 GS emulation – the final frontier of Vulkan compute emulation (119 points | 28 comments)
8. Taming the beast that is the Django ORM – An introduction (119 points | 63 comments)
9. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need (2022) [video] (344 points | 60 comments)
10. Did your car witness a crime? (231 points | 467 comments)
11. E Ink faces growing competition in the "paper-like" display space (51 points | 29 comments)
12. Build Your Own Z80 Computer: Design Guidelines and Application (19 points | discuss)
13. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (99 points | 31 comments)
14. The Null Pointer (38 points | 4 comments)
15. Ask HN: How To: Internal Documentation? (5 points | 3 comments)

19. The Atari 7800 (35 points | 7 comments)
20. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (67 points | 30 comments)
21. WatchYourLAN: Lightweight Network IP Scanner (141 points | 12 comments)
22. Astronomers puzzled by little red galaxies that seem impossibly dense (60 points | 38 comments)
23. Client-side QR code generator with SVG output (117 points | 22 comments)
24. Brazil's X ban is sending lots of people to Bluesky (268 points | 479 comments)
25. Epilepsy Protection for VRChat (26 points | 2 comments)
26. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (151 points | 41 comments)
27. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (161 points | 64 comments)
28. Non-Determinism and Overcount on Modern Hardware Performance Counters [pdf] (25 points | 1 comment)
29. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
30. Neutral beam microscopy using magnetic beam spin encoding (30 points | discuss)
